question.title: Newer install of Eclipse/Tomcat not treating JSP Session scopes correctly
question.body:
Got a new machine and had to do a new install of Eclipse and Tomcat, was not as easy in the past but got things running for the most part. However, I have JSP beans in a lot of my files like this.

<jsp:useBean id="objSusHelper" class="Sustainability.SustainabilityHelper" scope="session"/>

And the same class instance would be used for the whole session, but now I can tell it's being reinitialized everytime web pages are called by putting a breakpoint in the constructor, and it should not be doing that. Anyone know why that is? I really did try a search but coming up with nothing. Using the localhost tomcat8.5. using

System.out.println("Hashcode-"+objSusHelper.hashCode());

I can see three differnt ids for the main page and two ajax calls to initialize the page. Here is an example ajax page.

<%@ page import="java.sql.,java.util.ArrayList,org.json.,java.text.SimpleDateFormat" %> <%@ page import="java.sql.,java.util.,csd.sas.,csd.sas.Helpers."%> <jsp:useBean id="objSusHelper" class="csd.sas.Sustainability.SustainabilityHelper" scope="session"/>

<%

    String empno = request.getParameter("empno");

    System.out.println("Hashcode-"+objSusHelper.hashCode());

    String objBuf=objSusHelper.getGCListings(empno);

   out.println(objBuf); 
     

   %>

and here is the call to it

function setYearSelector(){

 $.getJSON('jsps/ajaxData/Sustainability/getYearSelects.jsp', function(data) {
     $( "#GCYear" ).append($('<option>', {
            value:"none",
            text: "Select a Year"
        }));
         $.each(data, function(index) {

               $( "#GCYear" ).append($('<option>', {
                    value:data[index].value,
                    text: data[index].label
                }));
            });
         
         
       });

}
